Autonomous Transportation System: The perfect city would have an autonomous transportation system that uses electric vehicles and renewable energy sources to reduce carbon emissions and traffic congestion. The transportation system would be integrated with smart traffic management systems that use real-time data to optimize routes and reduce travel time for residents.

Vertical Gardens: The perfect city would have extensive vertical gardens that provide natural habitats for wildlife and help purify the air by absorbing pollutants. These gardens would also serve as public spaces for residents to relax and enjoy nature.

Smart Waste Management: The perfect city would have a smart waste management system that uses sensors and automation to optimize waste collection and recycling processes. This system would reduce the amount of waste sent to landfills and promote sustainable waste practices.

Sustainable Water Supply: The perfect city would have a sustainable water supply system that uses rainwater harvesting, desalination, and recycled water for irrigation and domestic use. This system would ensure a consistent and reliable water supply while minimizing its environmental impact.

Community Gardens: The perfect city would have community gardens where residents can grow their own fruits and vegetables. These gardens would provide fresh produce to residents while promoting healthy eating habits and community engagement. Additionally, these gardens would serve as educational centers where residents can learn about sustainable agriculture and food production.
